summary: This is an email from November 2, 2021, discussing logistical details about sending hard drives and discs to the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC) for Ghislaine Maxwell's case. The sender clarifies that hard drives are sent to MDC Legal Counsel, not directly to the defendant, and questions the document's description of mail delivery procedures.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Referred to as the defendant (GM) for whom hard drives and discs are being sent to the detention center, but the email clarifies these items are not delivered directly to her.

events.title: Hard Drive Sent to MDC
events.description: A hard drive was sent to the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC) Legal Counsel, not directly to Ghislaine Maxwell.

keyFacts: Hard drives sent to the MDC for Ghislaine Maxwell's case are delivered to MDC Legal Counsel, not directly to the defendant.
There is a distinction in mailing procedures: discs are sent to a PO Box, while hard drives are sent to a different address for MDC Legal Counsel.
The correspondence corrects a prior document's implication that all inmate mail (FedEx and certified) is picked up by MDC from the same location.
